title: Sebastião Fernandes da Costa
text:
Sebastião Fernandes da Costa (<a href="Seia">Seia</a>, Santa Marinha, 17 December 1842 – 27 August 1889) was a <a href="Portuguese%20people">Portuguese</a> <a href="lawyer">lawyer</a> and <a href="politician">politician</a>.
His parents were Manuel da Costa (b. <a href="Seia">Seia</a>, Santa Marinha, – c. 1887), a small <a href="landowner">landowner</a> who was remembered by his grandson as carrying his <a href="Hoe%20%28tool%29">hoe</a> at the end of the day, and wife Clara de Jesus (b. in <a href="Oliveira%20do%20Hospital">Oliveira do Hospital</a>, Lagares, –).
He was a <a href="Bachelor%27s%20degree">Bachelor</a> graduated in <a href="Law">Law</a> by the <a href="University%20of%20Coimbra">University of Coimbra</a> and became a <a href="lawyer">lawyer</a>. He became the Conservator of the Predial Registration and <a href="Mayor">Mayor</a> of <a href="Seia">Seia</a>, and also Judge of the Brotherhood of the Holy Sacrament of <a href="Seia">Seia</a>.
He had three children who were exposed at birth at the wheel of the <a href="Santa%20Casa%20da%20Miseric%C3%B3rdia">Santa Casa da Misericórdia</a> (Holy House of Mercy) of <a href="Seia">Seia</a> and registered as children of unknown parents. Their mother was Ana Augusta Pereira (<a href="Oliveira%20do%20Hospital">Oliveira do Hospital</a>, Lagos da Beira, 10 February 1838 – <a href="Lisbon">Lisbon</a>, Rua Duque de Palmela, at her son Afonso's home, 23 May 1915), daughter of Tiago Ferrão (<a href="Oliveira%20do%20Hospital">Oliveira do Hospital</a>, Meruge, Nogueirinha, 1 August 1804 – died a victim as a consequence of the persecutions of the malefactor <a href="Jo%C3%A3o%20Brand%C3%A3o">João Brandão</a>) and wife Maria Pereira (<a href="Oliveira%20do%20Hospital">Oliveira do Hospital</a>, Lagos da Beira, 1 September 1809 –), a widow woman <a href="Weaver%20%28occupation%29">weaver</a> at <a href="Gouveia%20Municipality%2C%20Portugal">Gouveia</a> precociously <a href="Blindness">blind</a>. Later he and their mother recognized them and they married at <a href="Seia">Seia</a>, Seia on 13 April 1885. Their children were:
